title: Amazon and Roku avoid public slapping match with multi-year agreement
content:
Cable-style carriage disputes seemed like a thing of the past in this new age of streaming services, but paid placement or subsidized devices can spark the same public fights between large companies. Roku spent much of 2021 fighting with Google over YouTube and YouTube TV access, but thankfully, that has now been avoided with Amazon

The post Amazon and Roku avoid public slapping match with multi-year agreement appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Roku spent most of last year publicly fighting with Google over YouTube access, but that won't happen with Amazon services... for a while.
